sentences.sContent: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.
sentences.sCn: 这两个酿酒区之间有明显的不同。

sentences.sContent: ...the agreement specifies that there is no formal distinction between developed and developing nations in their responsibility to cut emissions...
...Scholars warn that Antarctica’s political drift could blur the distinction between military and civilian activities long before the continent’s treaties come up for renegotiation...
...Although the rigid high-low distinction fell apart in the 1960s...
...gave up the dubious distinction by establishing paid family leave starting in 2011...

synos.tran: 区别；差别；特性；荣誉、勋章

phrases.pCn: 以优异成绩，以杰出的表现

words.tran: 明显的；独特的；清楚的；有区别的
可区别的；辩认得出的；可辨识的
区分；辨别；使杰出，使表现突出

trans.tranOther: a clear difference or separation between two similar things
